sentence.Network_en: She objects to the tests the Government's advisers have devised because they constrict her teaching style.
sentence.Network_cn: 她反对政府顾问设计的考试，因为这些考试限制了她的教学风格。

sentence.Network_en: Panic can constrict the blood vessels and impose an additional burden on the heart.
sentence.Network_cn: 恐慌会使血管收缩,增加心脏负担.

sentence.Network_en: Nerves constrict the blood vessels in the extremities of the body.
sentence.Network_cn: 神经促使人手脚处的血管开始收缩.

wellhead connector 井口连接器wellhead constriction 井口油嘴wellhead crude oil sample 井口油样
含铜太少会限制电流流动,因而产生集中电阻(constriction resistance)。尺寸合适的铜迹线可以降低体电阻、降低温度并减小损耗。否则,热量可能“下沉”到连接器的接口.
·收缩因子(constriction factor)的引入第32页 　　·粒子群优化算法种群拓扑结构研究第32-36页 　　　　·代数式的变化第32-33页 　　　　.

derivation.yuyuan_name: mid 18th cent.: from Latin constrict- 'bound tightly together', from the verb constringere (see constrain)

entry.tran: (使)(身体部位，尤指喉咙)收紧，收缩
entry.def: If a part of your body, especially your throat, is constricted or if it constricts, something causes it to become narrower.

example.ex: Severe migraine can be treated with a drug which constricts the blood vessels...
example.tran: 严重的偏头疼可以用一种收缩血管的药物进行治疗。

example.ex: My throat constricted, so that I had to concentrate on breathing.
example.tran: 我的嗓子发紧，所以我不得不把注意力集中在呼吸上。

entry.def: If something constricts you, it limits your actions so that you cannot do what you want to do.

example.ex: She objects to the tests the Government's advisers have devised because they constrict her teaching style...
example.tran: 她反对政府顾问设计的考试，因为这些考试限制了她的教学风格。

example.ex: Men and women alike have been constricted by traditional sexual roles.
example.tran: 男性和女性同样受到传统性别角色的束缚。

means.word_mean: 2. become tight or as if tight;

auth_sentence.content: Greenhouses work because they constrict convection currents, which carry away the heat.
auth_sentence.res_content: Greenhouses work because they constrict convection currents, which carry away the heat.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Greenhouses work because they constrict convection currents, which carry away the heat.

auth_sentence.content: Sometimes when bright sunlight hits our eyes, the parasympathetic system responds appropriately and our pupils constrict.
auth_sentence.res_content: Sometimes when bright sunlight hits our eyes, the parasympathetic system responds appropriately and our pupils constrict.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Sometimes when bright sunlight hits our eyes, the parasympathetic system responds appropriately and our pupils constrict.

auth_sentence.content: It was a question of poor circulation, of the cold making the vessels constrict and cutting off the blood supply.
auth_sentence.res_content: It was a question of poor circulation, of the cold making the vessels constrict and cutting off the blood supply.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: It was a question of poor circulation, of the cold making the vessels constrict and cutting off the blood supply.

strict[adj.[with]严格的,严厉的;严谨的,精确的]+ure表名词→n.谴责,严厉,束缚

means.word_mean: 压缩, 压紧, 使收缩

sentences.en: The tight collar constricted his neck.

jushi.english: The tight collar constricted his neck.
A rubber band constricts what it encircles.
jushi.chinese: 橡皮圈将其环绕的东西箍得紧紧的。
